export const STAGE_WIDTH = window.innerWidth;
export const STAGE_HEIGHT = window.innerHeight;

name: src/core/GameServer.js
GameServer
description:
The GameServer Class is the primary way to communicate with a Game Server.
It uses WebSockets to implement bi-directional communication.
It extends EventEmitter which means you can subscribe to GameServer events.

name: constructor
description: Creates a GameServer

params.name: server
params.description:
Hostname/IP (prepended with a "ws://") of game
server.

params.name: playerHash
params.description: Unique Hash that represents the player.

name: connect
description: Connect to the Game Server

name: send
description:
Send a plain text message to the Game Server.
You should almost certainly never have to use this publically.

params.name: message
params.description: Message to send.

name: getProtocolString
description:
Generate protocol prefix from protocol Array.

Convert array of ASCII indices to a string with the respective ASCII values.

params.name: protocol
params.description: ASCII table indices.

name: dispatch
description: Dispatch an action to the GameServer

params.name: action
params.description: Server to commit; Obtain this by using one of the GameServer's Action methods.

name: src/game.js
src/plugins/phaser-plugin-isometric.js

unknown.tagValue:
Isometric is a comprehensive axonometric plugin for Phaser which provides an API for handling axonometric projection of assets in 3D space to the screen.
The goal has been to mimic as closely as possible the existing APIs provided by Phaser for standard orthogonal 2D projection, but add a third dimension.
Also included is an Arcade-based 3D AABB physics engine, which again is closely equivalent in functionality and its API.

params.name: game
params.description: The current game instance.

params.name: isometricType
params.description: the isometric projection angle to use.

unknown.tagValue: Creates a new Cube object with the bottom-back corner specified by the x, y and z parameters, with the specified breadth (widthX), depth (widthY) and height parameters. If you call this function without parameters, a Cube with x, y, z, breadth, depth and height properties set to 0 is created.

params.name: x
params.description: The x coordinate of the bottom-back corner of the Cube.

params.name: y
params.description: The y coordinate of the bottom-back corner of the Cube.

params.name: z
params.description: The z coordinate of the bottom-back corner of the Cube.

params.name: widthX
params.description: The X axis width (breadth) of the Cube. Should always be either zero or a positive value.

params.name: widthY
params.description: The Y axis width (depth) of the Cube. Should always be either zero or a positive value.

params.name: height
params.description: The Z axis height of the Cube. Should always be either zero or a positive value.

name: size
description: The size of the Cube object, expressed as a Point3 object with the values of the widthX, widthY and height properties.

params.name: a
params.description: The Cube object.

params.name: output
params.description: Optional Point3 object. If given the values will be set into the object, otherwise a brand new Point3 object will be created and returned.

return.description: The size of the Cube object

name: clone
description: Returns a new Cube object with the same values for the x, y, z, widthX, widthY, and height properties as the original Cube object.

params.name: a
params.description: The Cube object.

params.name: output
params.description: Optional Cube object. If given the values will be set into the object, otherwise a brand new Cube object will be created and returned.

name: contains
description: Determines whether the specified coordinates are contained within the region defined by this Cube object.

params.name: a
params.description: The Cube object.

params.name: x
params.description: The x coordinate of the point to test.

params.name: y
params.description: The y coordinate of the point to test.

params.name: z
params.description: The z coordinate of the point to test.

return.description: A value of true if the Cube object contains the specified point; otherwise false.

name: containsXY
description: Determines whether the specified X and Y coordinates are contained within the region defined by this Cube object.

params.name: a
params.description: The Cube object.

params.name: x
params.description: The x coordinate of the point to test.

params.name: y
params.description: The y coordinate of the point to test.

return.description: A value of true if the Cube object contains the specified point; otherwise false.

name: containsPoint3
description: Determines whether the specified point is contained within the cubic region defined by this Cube object. This method is similar to the Cube.contains() method, except that it takes a Point3 object as a parameter.

params.name: a
params.description: The Cube object.

params.name: point3
params.description: The Point3 object being checked. Can be Point3 or any object with .x, .y and .z values.

return.description: A value of true if the Cube object contains the specified point; otherwise false.

name: containsCube
description:
Determines whether the first Cube object is fully contained within the second Cube object.
A Cube object is said to contain another if the second Cube object falls entirely within the boundaries of the first.

params.name: a
params.description: The first Cube object.

params.name: b
params.description: The second Cube object.

return.description: A value of true if the Cube object contains the specified point; otherwise false.

name: intersects
description:
Determines whether the two Cubes intersect with each other.
This method checks the x, y, z, widthX, widthY, and height properties of the Cubes.

params.name: a
params.description: The first Cube object.

params.name: b
params.description: The second Cube object.

return.description: A value of true if the specified object intersects with this Cube object; otherwise false.

unknown.tagValue:
Create a new `IsoSprite` object. IsoSprites are extended versions of standard Sprites that are suitable for axonometric positioning.

IsoSprites are simply Sprites that have three new position properties (isoX, isoY and isoZ) and ask the instance of Phaser.Plugin.Isometric.Projector what their position should be in a 2D scene whenever these properties are changed.
The IsoSprites retain their 2D position property to prevent any problems and allow you to interact with them as you would a normal Sprite. The upside of this simplicity is that things should behave predictably for those already used to Phaser.

params.name: game
params.description: A reference to the currently running game.

params.name: x
params.description: The x coordinate (in 3D space) to position the IsoSprite at.

params.name: y
params.description: The y coordinate (in 3D space) to position the IsoSprite at.

params.name: z
params.description: The z coordinate (in 3D space) to position the IsoSprite at.

params.name: key
params.description: This is the image or texture used by the IsoSprite during rendering. It can be a string which is a reference to the Cache entry, or an instance of a RenderTexture or PIXI.Texture.

params.name: frame
params.description: If this IsoSprite is using part of a sprite sheet or texture atlas you can specify the exact frame to use by giving a string or numeric index.

name: postUpdate
description: Internal function called by the World postUpdate cycle.

name: _project
description: Internal function that performs the axonometric projection from 3D to 2D space.

name: isoSprite
description: Create a new IsoSprite with specific position and sprite sheet key.

params.name: x
params.description: X position of the new IsoSprite.

params.name: y
params.description: Y position of the new IsoSprite.

params.name: y
params.description: Z position of the new IsoSprite.

params.name: key
params.description: This is the image or texture used by the Sprite during rendering. It can be a string which is a reference to the Cache entry, or an instance of a RenderTexture or PIXI.Texture.

params.name: frame
params.description: If the sprite uses an image from a texture atlas or sprite sheet you can pass the frame here. Either a number for a frame ID or a string for a frame name.

params.name: group
params.description: Optional Group to add the object to. If not specified it will be added to the World group.

name: isoSprite
description: Create a new IsoSprite with specific position and sprite sheet key.

params.name: x
params.description: X position of the new IsoSprite.

params.name: y
params.description: Y position of the new IsoSprite.

params.name: y
params.description: Z position of the new IsoSprite.

params.name: key
params.description: This is the image or texture used by the Sprite during rendering. It can be a string which is a reference to the Cache entry, or an instance of a RenderTexture or PIXI.Texture.

params.name: frame
params.description: If the sprite uses an image from a texture atlas or sprite sheet you can pass the frame here. Either a number for a frame ID or a string for a frame name.

params.name: group
params.description: Optional Group to add the object to. If not specified it will be added to the World group.

name: Octree
description: Octree Constructor

unknown.tagValue:
A Octree implementation based on Phaser.QuadTree.
Original version at https://github.com/timohausmann/quadtree-js/

params.name: x
params.description: The bottom-back coordinate of the octree.

params.name: y
params.description: The bottom-back coordinate of the octree.

params.name: z
params.description: The bottom-back coordinate of the octree.

params.name: widthX
params.description: The width X (breadth) of the octree.

params.name: widthY
params.description: The width Y (depth) of the octree.

params.name: height
params.description: The height (Z) of the octree.

params.name: maxObjects
params.description: The maximum number of objects per node.

params.name: maxLevels
params.description: The maximum number of levels to iterate to.

params.name: level
params.description: Which level is this?

name: octree
description: Visually renders an Octree to the display.

params.name: octree
params.description: The octree to render.

params.name: color
params.description: The color of the lines in the quadtree.

unknown.tagValue:
The Point3 object represents a location in a three-dimensional coordinate system,
where x and y represent the horizontal axes and z represents the vertical axis.
The following code creates a point at (0,0,0):
`var myPoint = new Phaser.Plugin.Isometric.Point3();`

Creates a new Point3 object. If you pass no parameters a Point3 is created set to (0, 0, 0).

params.name: x
params.description: The horizontal X position of this Point.

params.name: y
params.description: The horizontal Y position of this Point.

params.name: z
params.description: The vertical position of this Point.

name: add
description: Adds the coordinates of two points together to create a new point.

params.name: a
params.description: The first Point3 object.

params.name: b
params.description: The second Point3 object.

params.name: out
params.description: Optional Point3 to store the value in, if not supplied a new Point3 object will be created.

name: subtract
description: Subtracts the coordinates of two points to create a new point.

params.name: a
params.description: The first Point3 object.

params.name: b
params.description: The second Point3 object.

params.name: out
params.description: Optional Point3 to store the value in, if not supplied a new Point3 object will be created.

name: multiply
description: Multiplies the coordinates of two points to create a new point.

params.name: a
params.description: The first Point3 object.

params.name: b
params.description: The second Point3 object.

params.name: out
params.description: Optional Point3 to store the value in, if not supplied a new Point3 object will be created.

name: divide
description: Divides the coordinates of two points to create a new point.

params.name: a
params.description: The first Point3 object.

params.name: b
params.description: The second Point3 object.

params.name: out
params.description: Optional Point3 to store the value in, if not supplied a new Point3 object3 will be created.

name: equals
description: Determines whether the two given Point3 objects are equal. They are considered equal if they have the same x, y and z values.

params.name: a
params.description: The first Point3 object.

params.name: b
params.description: The second Point3 object.

return.description: A value of true if the Points3 are equal, otherwise false.

unknown.tagValue: Creates a new Isometric Projector object, which has helpers for projecting x, y and z coordinates into axonometric x and y equivalents.

params.name: game
params.description: The current game object.

params.name: projectionAngle
params.description: The angle of the axonometric projection in radians. Defaults to approx. 0.4636476 (Math.atan(0.5) which is suitable for 2:1 pixel art dimetric)

unknown.tagValue:
The Physics Body is linked to a single IsoSprite. All physics operations should be performed against the body rather than
the IsoSprite itself. For example you can set the velocity, acceleration, bounce values etc all on the Body.

params.name: sprite
params.description: The IsoSprite object this physics body belongs to.

name: render
description: Render IsoSprite Body.

params.name: context
params.description: The context to render to.

params.name: body
params.description: The Body to render the info of.

params.name: color
params.description: color of the debug info to be rendered. (format is css color string).

params.name: filled
params.description: Render the objected as a filled (default, true) or a stroked (false)

name: renderBodyInfo
description: Render IsoSprite Body Physics Data as text.

params.name: body
params.description: The Body to render the info of.

params.name: x
params.description: X position of the debug info to be rendered.

params.name: y
params.description: Y position of the debug info to be rendered.

params.name: color
params.description: color of the debug info to be rendered. (format is css color string).

name: Arcade
description: IsoArcade Physics constructor.

params.name: game
params.description: reference to the current game instance.
